properties.entry: Set various parameters to select assets.
A file is required for file upload asset selection.
Processing will continue if you wish to navigate away from this page at any time.

Returns assets that matches the combination of all values provided.

The search returns all assets that has values which start with the provided text. For example searching for any field that begins with "12" will return values such as 12, 1234 but will not return 1, 1123, nor 112.
Are you sure you want to delete hardware: {0}?
All values in a section must be filled to be sent. Empty sections will not be sent.

The minimum amount of time that must pass after a PQR event before another PQR event may occur. If line conditions would normally cause a PQR event to trigger, but the Minimum Event Separation time hasn’t passed since the previous event, the new event will be inhibited.
The voltage threshold to trigger an over-voltage PQR event. This value must be greater than the Restore value.
The voltage threshold to end an over-voltage PQR event.
The length of time that the line voltage must exceed the trigger value before an over-voltage PQR event will be activated.
The length of time that the line voltage must be below the restore value before an over-voltage PQR event will end.
The minimum length of time that an over-voltage PQR event can run. Once started, the event will continue for at least this amount of time, even if the line condition would otherwise cause it to end.
The maximum length of time that an over-voltage PQR event can run. Once an event exceeds this length, it will be automatically ended, even if the line condition would otherwise cause it to continue.
When an over-voltage PQR event is triggered, the device will wait for a randomized interval, less than or equal to the Trigger Randomization time, before starting the event.
When an over-voltage PQR event restoration would occur, the device will wait for a randomized interval, less than or equal to the Restore Randomization time, before ending the event.
The threshold to trigger an over-frequency PQR event. This value must be less than the Restore value.
The threshold to end an over-frequency PQR event.
The length of time that the line frequency must exceed the trigger value before an over-frequency PQR event will be activated.
The length of time that the line frequency must be below the restore value before an over-frequency PQR event will end.

The minimum amount of time that an over-frequency PQR event can run. Once started, the event will continue for at least this amount of time, even if the line condition would otherwise cause it to end.

The maximum amount of time that an over-frequency PQR event can run. Once an event exceeds this length, it will be automatically ended, even if the line condition would otherwise cause it to continue.
When an over-frequency PQR event is triggered, the device will wait for a randomized interval, less than or equal to the Trigger Randomization time, before starting the event.
When an over-frequency PQR event restoration would occur, the device will wait for a randomized interval, less than or equal to the Restore Randomization time, before ending the event.
The following PQR configuration will be sent to the specified devices:
The configuration is invalid. Please check errors below.
Value cannot be empty if other values in section are specified.
Trigger must be greater than Restore
Trigger must be less than Restore
Minimum must be less than Maximum.
Add by SN Range task canceled after {0} items were processed.
Starting serial number must be less than or equal to ending serial number.
Starting serial number must be numeric.
Ending serial number must be numeric.
Starting serial number for the LCR 3102 device type must be less than 2147483648.
Ending serial number for the LCR 3102 device type must be less than 2147483648.
The device name is unavailable: LCR2W {0}
Serial number: {0} is already in use.
Creation failed for serial number: {0}, reason: {1}
Field install date is not a valid date.
Program signup date is not a valid date.
Device status from date is not a valid date.
Device status to date is not a valid date.
The device status start date cannot be after the device status stop date.
Serial number range is not available if any devices have serial numbers containing alpha-numeric characters.
Serial number range start must be less than or equal to range end.
Serial number ranges must be greater than zero or equal to zero.
Serial number range start is not a valid number.
Serial number range end is not a valid number.
There are currently no service companies.
Selecting any of these options will not immediately make any changes.
Schedule a task to send current configuration.
Choose new configuration settings and send to all devices.
This task sends load management configuration messages to all devices in the collection.
Resend Configuration task canceled after {0} items were processed.
Name of the asset configuration task cannot be empty.
Name must be 250 characters or less.
The devices chosen have mulitple configuration types. Choose the type that applies the to devices you want to configure. Devices not using this configuration type will be ignored.
Select An Action To Perform On Selected Assets
Selecting any of these options will not immediately make any changes.
Write collection to a batch configuration file.
Run a control audit report for two-way devices.
View a report of device details.
View a report of PQR events.
It is possible to create a batch file that will affect the route & group of all assets in the selected collection.
The hardware collection contains multiple hardware configuration types.
Asset configuration can only be updated when all devices share a single hardware configuration type.
Use routes assigned to the switches
This will permanently delete all assets in the selected collection.
Change Device Type of Selected Assets
This will change the device type of all assets in the selected collection except the assets whose original type does not support the change type action.
Change Device Status of Selected Assets
This will change the device status of all assets in the selected collection.
Change Service Company of Selected Assets
This will change the service company of all assets in the selected collection.
This will change the warehouse of all assets in the selected collection.
Are you sure you want to delete this command schedule entry?
Hours or Minutes must be set.
Hours or Minutes must be set.
Hours must be greater than zero.
Minutes must be greater than zero.
Seconds must be greater than zero.
Duration must be greater than zero.
Duration must be greater than zero.
Duration hours is not a valid number.
Duration minutes is not a valid number.
Delay seconds is not a valid number.
Are you sure you want to delete task "{0}"?
